english_translation: Narrated by Imran ibn al-Husayn: There was an al-Adamaa (a famous fast she-camel) belonging to a man from Bani Uqayl. She was among the swift she-camels of the pilgrims, and he was captured. When the Prophet ﷺ came upon him in chains, while the Prophet ﷺ was riding on a donkey with a saddle-cloth, the man said: O Muhammad, why are you taking me and the swift she-camel of the pilgrims? The Prophet ﷺ said: We are taking you because of the sin of your allies, Thaqif. He said: Thaqif had captured two of the Companions of the Prophet ﷺ. And he (Imran) said: He (the man) said: I am a Muslim.

english_translation: Narrated by Imran ibn al-Husayn: The Prophet ﷺ captured a man from Bani Uqayl, and bound him and threw him in al-Harra. When he (the prisoner) left, he called out: O Muhammad! So the Prophet ﷺ came to him. He said: Why do you take me and the al-Adamaa, which is a swift she-camel of the pilgrims? He said: Because you are an ally of Thaqif. When the Prophet ﷺ left, he called him again saying: O Muhammad, why are you taking me when I am a Muslim? He said: If you had said this while you still possessed yourself, you would have achieved complete success. The Prophet ﷺ left, but he (the prisoner) called out again: O Muhammad, O Muhammad! The Prophet ﷺ returned and he said: You are leaving me here without food or drink. He said: That is what you intended. So the Prophet ﷺ ransomed him with two of his Companions who were prisoners of war.

english_translation: We came to the Messenger of Allah asking him for mounts. He swore he would not give us mounts and that he had nothing to mount us on. We stayed as long as Allah willed, then camels came, and he ordered five white camels for us. When we left, some of us said to others: We made the Messenger of Allah forget his oath, may Allah not bless us. Let us return to remind him. We returned and said: O Messenger of Allah, we came to you asking for mounts, and you swore not to give us mounts, then you gave us mounts. Did you forget, O Messenger of Allah? He said: By Allah, if Allah wills, I do not swear an oath and then see something better than it except that I do what is better and make expiation for my oath. Go, for Allah has mounted you.
